text: Thomas Gene Fisher (April 4, 1942 – November 21, 2016) was a Major League Baseball pitcher. Nicknamed "Big Fish", the 6'0", 180 lb. right-hander was signed by the Baltimore Orioles as an amateur free agent before the 1962 season. He played briefly for the Orioles in 1967. Fisher had a record of 10–6 with a 3.04 earned run average for the Triple-A Rochester Red Wings when he was called up to Baltimore in September 1967. His career minor league record at the time was 65–33, a winning percentage of .663. He made his major league debut in relief on September 20 against the Washington Senators at D.C. Stadium. He pitched 1.1 scoreless innings, walking two batters. His second big league action came two days later, in a home game against the Boston Red Sox. He hurled two more scoreless innings, striking out one batter, All-Star catcher Elston Howard. On April 30, 1969 he was traded by the Orioles along with pitcher John O'Donoghue to the Seattle Pilots, and never again made it to the major league level. His lifetime ERA for 3.1 innings stands at 0.00. ==Minor League Trivia== *Fisher led Northern League pitchers with 16 complete games while playing for the Aberdeen Pheasants in 1964. *He led Eastern League pitchers in complete games (16), shutouts (4), winning percentage (.700), strikeouts (142), and ERA (1.88) while playing for the Elmira Pioneers in 1966. *He tied for the International League lead with 5 shutouts in 1967. ==External links== , or Retrosheet, or Pura Pelota (Venezuelan Winter League) * Obituary Category:1942 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Aberdeen Pheasants players Category:Appleton Foxes players Category:Baltimore Orioles players Category:Baseball players from Ohio Category:Bluefield Orioles players Category:Elmira Pioneers players Category:Florida Instructional League Orioles players Category:Fox Cities Foxes players Category:Indianapolis Indians players Category:Jacksonville Suns players Category:Major League Baseball pitchers Category:Navegantes del Magallanes players Category:Ohio Bobcats baseball players Category:Ohio University alumni Category:Portland Beavers players Category:Rochester Red Wings players Category:Sportspeople from Cleveland Category:Stockton Ports players Category:Tri-City Atoms players Category:Vancouver Mounties players
title: Tom Fisher (1960s pitcher)
